HipsPCGlute.name: Lever Glute Stretch
HipsPCGlute.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower leg on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold lower bar with overhand grip. Position ankle on thigh or knee.
HipsPCGlute.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsPCGlute.comments: Ankle can be placed on top edge of shin pad if it can not be positioned above knee.

HipsLying.name: Lying Glute Stretch
HipsLying.preparation: Lie on floor or mat. Bend knees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg over thigh of other leg. Grasp back of thigh of lower leg with both hands.
HipsLying.execution: Pull leg toward torso. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsLying.comments: If thigh can not be reached or held on to consider performing Modified Lying Glute Stretch or Towel Lying Glute Stretch. The Lying Glute Stretch should not be confused with Lying Piriformis Stretch in which overlying leg is adducted over far thigh and arms are positioned around both legs.

HipsLyingModified.name: Lying Glute Stretch
HipsLyingModified.preparation: Lie on floor or mat. Bend knees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg over thigh of other leg. Grasp foot and knee with both hands.
HipsLyingModified.execution: Pull leg toward torso. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsLyingModified.comments: Notice knee extends out to side more than Lying Piriformis Stretch. Also see Lying Glute Stretch for alternative form.

HipsPNFLying.name: PNF Lying Glute Stretch
HipsPNFLying.preparation: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat. Kneel beside participant. Bend participants knee and hip and rotate leg cross wise. Position outside of participants knee on nearest shoulder with participants lower leg extended under arm. Position near ankle on participants opposite lower leg.
HipsPNFLying.execution: Extend or place hands on mat to each side of participant. Push participants leg by leaning toward participant. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsPNFLying.comments: See PNF stretch techniques. Also see Modified Lying Glute Stretch for similar static stretch.

HipsLyingTowel.name: Towel Lying Glute Stretch
HipsLyingTowel.preparation: Lasso lower thigh with towel and lie on floor or mat. Bend knees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg over thigh of lassoed leg. Holding each side of towel position towel under knee.
HipsLyingTowel.execution: Pull both ends of towel so leg travels toward torso. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsLyingTowel.comments: This exercise can be performed if thigh can not be reached or held on to during Lying Glute Stretch.

HipsLyingWall.name: Lying Wall Glute Stretch
HipsLyingWall.preparation: Sit on floor with hip and thigh against wall. Lift back of legs up against wall by pivoting on hips and lying on back. Cross lower leg over thigh of straight leg.
HipsLyingWall.execution: Bend knee of straight leg while lowering heel on wall. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.

HipsProneGlute.name: Prone Glute Stretch
HipsProneGlute.preparation: Sit on floor or mat with outside of lower leg bent in front so it is approximately perpendicular to body. Place hands on floor in front and extend opposite leg back on floor so knee is toward floor.
HipsProneGlute.execution: Allow body to ease down toward floor with support of arms. Hold stretch and repeat with opposite leg.
HipsProneGlute.comments: Allow hip to straighten toward floor for additional hip flexor stretch.

HipsSeatedBentover.name: Seated Bent-over Glute Stretch
HipsSeatedBentover.preparation: Sit on floor or mat with outside of lower leg bent in front and inside of opposite lower leg bent to side. Position bottom of forward foot against knee of opposite leg. Place hands on floor in front of forward leg.
HipsSeatedBentover.execution: Reach or slide forward with support of arms and hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsSeatedBentover.comments: Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

HipsSeatedBench.name: Seated Glute Stretch (bench)
HipsSeatedBench.preparation: Straddle bench and sit. With one foot on floor, place outside of other foot on bench close to pelvis.
HipsSeatedBench.execution: Lean down, lowering torso toward thighs. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsSeatedBench.comments: Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

HipsSeated.name: Seated Glute Stretch (chair)
HipsSeated.preparation: Sit on chair or bench with ankles positioned below knees. Cross lower leg over thigh of opposite leg.
HipsSeated.execution: Lean down, lowering torso toward thighs. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsSeated.comments: Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

HipsSeatedFloor.name: Seated Glute Stretch
HipsSeatedFloor.preparation: Sit on floor or mat reclining back with support of both arms behind body. Bend knees approximately 90 degrees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg (just above ankle) over thigh of opposite leg.
HipsSeatedFloor.execution: Bring torso upright by walking hands closer to hips, keeping arms straight. Lean forward and hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsSeatedFloor.comments: Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

HipsPNFSeated.name: PNF Seated Glute Stretch
HipsPNFSeated.preparation: Instruct participant to sit on floor or mat, reclining back with support of both arms behind body, and feet on floor and knees bent. Have them cross their lower leg (just above ankle) over thigh of opposite leg. Position chest on participants back and grasp participants lower knee and upper ankle.
HipsPNFSeated.execution: Push participants torso toward legs. Hold stretch. Repeat with legs in opposite position
HipsPNFSeated.comments: See PNF stretch techniques. The Seated Glute Stretch can also be performed as static stretch.

HipsStandingGlute.name: Standing Glute Stretch
HipsStandingGlute.preparation: Stand facing close to elevated platform. Place outside of foot on bench with knee bent out to side.
HipsStandingGlute.execution: Lean down, lowering torso toward thighs. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsStandingGlute.comments: Hands may be placed on elevated platform to maintain balance. Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

HipsSquatting.name: Squatting Glute Stretch
HipsSquatting.preparation: Stand toward fixed bar, approximately waist height. Grasp bar with both hands, arms extended. Bend knees and hips slightly. Cross lower leg over lower thigh of opposite leg.
HipsSquatting.execution: Squat lower and lean forward toward crossed leg. Hold stretch . Repeat with opposite leg.
HipsSquatting.comments: Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.
